Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VueRouter with empty subroute path and named routes.  don't redirect" (#1898) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version 
3.0.0

### Steps to reproduce
I have defined a nested router in the project that contains an empty subroute path

router.js

``` js
Vue.use(Router)

export default new Router({
  routes: [{
    path: '/',
    name: 'HelloWorld',
    component: HelloWorld
  }, {
    path: '/a',
    name: 'a',
    component: A,
    children: [{
      path: 'b',
      name: 'b',
      component: B
    }, {
      path: '',
      redirect: 'b'
    }]
  }]
})
```
When use a named route to access 'a', url cannot redirect.
```
<router-link :to="{ name: 'a' }">access a</router-link>
```

But I use path to access 'a', which can be redirected normally.
```
<router-link :to="{ path: '/a' }">access a</router-link>
```
